item.title: I Whistle a Happy Tune
item.description: The old fake it til you make it may indeed be an effective strategy for many, however I am of the opinion that its application to any practical craft has been misinterpreted as a shortcut way to bypass the necessary work that brings adequate skill, from whence true confidence allegedly emanates - if I fake it I might as well be doing it, so watch me fly. So what happens if the faking isn’t any good? You can’t fake a lack of skill (ehm…). But what about a lack of confidence or self-assurance, even when the skill is more than sufficient and up to the task? There is where the true, scientifically tested effect of the tired adage may actually serve us with its true potential. Affirmations do indeed work wonders, because if I don’t believe in myself, who else will?
